operations

Class Checks

  • java.lang.Object
    • operations.Checks

  • public class Checks
extends java.lang.Object
    This is the Checks class. We built this class as we had a lot of checking being made on inputs and different conditions inside methods of core classes. We found that it would be better to locate them here instead.
    Author:
    Robert Keenan and Ciaran Nolan

    • Method Detail

      • checkIfValidGame

        public static boolean checkIfValidGame()
        Method to check if a game can still continue
        Returns:
        1 if playerList.size() greater than 1 and numPlayersBankrupt less than 2, 0 otherwise

      • checkSquare

        public static void checkSquare(int index,
                               Player player,
                               java.io.BufferedReader userInput)
        This is used to check the square that a player object lands on and handles whether you can buy it, if they are the owner already or needing to pay rent. If it's a Special Square, it uses the implementSpecialSquare function, and Property, Train and Utility have similar functionality in terms of rent, building (Property only) and mortgaging
        Parameters:
        index - The index location on the board of the square
        player - The Player object currently on that square
        userInput - BufferedReader used for simulating user input for much more complex tests in JUnit

      • enoughFunds

        public static boolean enoughFunds(Player player,
                                  int price)
        Method to check if a player has enough funds to complete a specific action
        Parameters:
        player - The Player object in question
        price - The amount of money needed to pay for the action
        Returns:
        1 if they can pay, 0 if they can't

      • checkPlayerStatus

        public static void checkPlayerStatus(Player player)
        Current status of a player which is printed to the screen. It prints the location of the player, how many jail free cards they have, owned properties and cash.
        Parameters:
        player - The Player object which will have its data printed to the screen

      • checkPlayerCanOwnStatus

        static void checkPlayerCanOwnStatus(Player player)
        Prints out the status of a Player object's CanOwn list or Title Deed list. These are the CanOwn object's that the Player owns due to them holding the TitleDeed card. If a property is in their list of TitleDeed cards, it also presents how many houses and hotels are on the Properties.
        Parameters:
        player - The player who wishes to display the information about the ownable sites in their possession

      • isPlayerOwner

        static boolean isPlayerOwner(TitleDeed ownableCard,
                             Player player)
        This method is used to check if the TitleDeed card provided is owned by the Player object given as an argument
        Parameters:
        ownableCard - TitleDeed card which is being checked
        player - The Player object being checked
        Returns:
        true if player is owner, false if ownableCard has no owner or player is not owner

      • ownAllColour

        public static java.util.ArrayList<Property> ownAllColour(Player player,
                                                         Property property)
        This method is used to check if the Player object owns all Properties of a certain colour group which can be used for obtaining higher rent and building on these properties. It loops through the Player object's TitleDeed card searching for each owned site and their colour.
        Parameters:
        player - The Player Object being checked for owning all of a colour group
        property - The type of property which is being checked which can be used to find the right colours
        Returns:
        null if no property provided or counter not satisifed, propertyList if they own all colours

      • evenHouseDistribution

        public static boolean evenHouseDistribution(java.util.ArrayList<Property> colourGroup,
                                            Property propertyToAlterHouses,
                                            boolean buyOrSell)
        This checks for an even house distribution across the colour group of Properties. There cannot be greater than 1 house difference between properties in the same colour group and this method checks that this is the case.
        Parameters:
        colourGroup - The Colour group of Property objects
        propertyToAlterHouses - A Property object which you want to alter
        buyOrSell - Buying or selling houses boolean
        Returns:
        true if even house distribution, false if not

      • canBuildHousesHotels

        public static int canBuildHousesHotels(Property propToBuild,
                                       Player player)
        To check if a Property object can be built on with houses and hotels. It checks whether the Property is owned by the Player and whether the Player has enough money. It then has to check if the Player owns all the Properties in a colour group
        Parameters:
        propToBuild - The Property object to build on
        player - The Player object who wants to build on propToBuild
        Returns:
        -1 attempt again, -2 exit without building anything, 0 you can build on this

      • checkHouseHotelValue

        public static int checkHouseHotelValue(Player player)
        This method checks all of the combined value of hotels and houses and is particularly useful at the end of the game when we are checking who won the game because of asset value
        Parameters:
        player - The Player object who we are checking the house and hotel value for
        Returns:
        valOfHousesHotels, the total value of all houses and hotels on owned sites

      • checkMortgagingValue

        public static int checkMortgagingValue(Player player)
        Check the value of mortgaging CanOwn objects in the Player object's title deed list. Useful for when we are checking how much money a player object needs to raise to get out of bankruptcy.
        Parameters:
        player - Player who we are checking the value of their CanOwn objects' mortgages
        Returns:
        mortgageValue, total mortgage value of all of these

      • checkBankruptcyTradeValue

        public static int checkBankruptcyTradeValue(Player player)
        This is used in the bankruptcy operation when a Player object is trying to obtain more money to pay off debts. This method checks the total value of a currently negotiated provisional trade with another player
        Parameters:
        player - Player object who has negotiated a provisional trade
        Returns:
        valOfTrades, total value of provisional trades

      • checkWinner

        public static void checkWinner()
        This method determines the winner of the game when 2 players in the game have gone bankrupt. If there is only one player left in the player list, then that player is declared the winner automatically. If not, the method runs through each player in the player list and combines the value of all of their houses and hotels on sites at their original buy price and also the value of all CanOwn objects owned (TitleDeed cards of these). It will then compare the other players' net worth and whoever is highest wins the game and their total asset value is printed to the screen
